hook.text: A sharp pull in your hamstring mid-sprint. You just strained a muscle. But what actually happened inside?

buildup.text: A strain is a tear in muscle fibers. Grade one is mild stretching, grade two is partial tear, grade three is complete.

discovery.text: Strains occur when muscles lengthen while contracting â€” called eccentric loading. Sprinting is a classic cause.

twist.text: Eccentric training actually prevents strains. Loading muscles in their lengthened position builds resilience.

climax.text: Most strains happen to muscles that cross two joints â€” hamstrings, calves, and hip flexors are the usual targets.

punchline.text: Strains are tears from overstretch under load. Eccentric training prevents them.
